title: The New rangers (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Kakadu National Park (N.T.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/National parks and reserves - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Kakadu National Park (N.T.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Park rangers
description: Looks at the new breed of rangers being trained at Kakadu National Park. The training program is for Aboriginals whose families have been the traditional owners of the area. The aim is that Kakadu will be managed and run by the Aboriginal people, who will pass on a little of their culture to the visitors who come to see the park.
